title: Jeff Reine-Adelaide joins Angers on loan from Arsenal
description: Arsenal midfielder Jeff Reine-Adelaide has joined Ligue 1 side Angers on loan for the remainder of the season.
content: Reine-Adelaide, 20, joined Arsenal in 2015 and made his debut in the third round of the FA Cup against Sunderland in January 2016.The midfielder has made eight senior appearances for the first-team under Arsene Wenger in all competitions, but has failed to work his way into the senior team this season due to a string of injuries.Reine-Adelaide's current contract with Arsenal expires in 2019.Angers currently sit in 16th place in Ligue 1 just a point clear of the relegation zone.Defender Krystian Bielik also left Arsenal on a loan deal on deadline day, joining Walsall until the end of the season.Bielik spent last season on loan at Birmingham City making 10 appearances for the Blues, including eight starts.Arsenal announced the signing of Pierre Emerick-Aubameyang from Borussia Dortmund and the sale of Olivier Giroud to Chelsea on a busy Deadline Day at the Emirates Stadium.Get Sky Sports from Â£18 a month and watch the latest transfers live in action for their new teams.
